verses.verse: It happened,<WH4428> when king Hezekiah<WH2396> heard<WH8085> it,<WH7167> that he tore his clothes,<WH899> and covered<WH3680> himself with sackcloth,<WH8242> and went<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of Yahweh.<WH3068>

He sent<WH7971> Eliakim,<WH471> who was over the household,<WH1004> and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe,<WH5608> and the elders<WH2205> of the priests,<WH3548> covered<WH3680> with sackcloth,<WH8242> to Isaiah<WH3470> the prophet<WH5030> the son<WH1121> of Amoz.<WH531>

They said<WH559> to him,<WH559> "Thus says Hezekiah,<WH2396> <WH3117> 'This day is a day<WH3117> of trouble,<WH6869> of rebuke,<WH8433> and of rejection;<WH5007> for the children<WH1121> have come<WH935> to the point of birth,<WH4866> and there is no strength<WH3581> to deliver them.<WH3205>

It may be<WH194> Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> will hear<WH8085> all the words<WH1697> of Rabshakeh,<WH7262> whom the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> his master<WH113> has sent<WH7971> to defy<WH2778> the living<WH2416> God,<WH430> and will rebuke<WH3198> the words<WH1697> which Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> has heard.<WH8085> Therefore lift up<WH5375> your prayer<WH8605> for the remnant<WH7611> that is left.<WH4672>'"
So the servants<WH5650> of king<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396> came<WH935> to Isaiah.<WH3470>

Isaiah<WH3470> said<WH559> to them,<WH559> "Thus you shall tell your master,<WH113> <WH559> 'Thus says Yahweh,<WH3068> "Don't<WH3372> be afraid of<WH6440> the words<WH1697> that you have heard,<WH8085> with which the servants<WH5288> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> have blasphemed me.<WH1442>

Behold,<WH5414> I will put a spirit<WH7307> in him,<WH8085> and he will hear news,<WH8052> and will return<WH7725> to his own land.<WH776> I will cause him to fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719> in his own land.<WH776>"'"

So Rabshakeh<WH7262> returned,<WH7725> and found<WH4672> the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> warring<WH3898> against Libnah;<WH3841> for he had heard<WH8085> that he had departed<WH5265> from Lachish.<WH3923>

When he heard<WH8085> it said<WH559> of Tirhakah<WH8640> king<WH4428> of Ethiopia,<WH3568> "Behold,<WH3318> he has come out to fight<WH3898> against you,<WH7971> he sent messengers<WH4397> again<WH7725> to Hezekiah,<WH2396> saying,<WH559>

<WH559> 'Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> saying,<WH559> "Don't<WH430> let your God in whom you trust<WH982> deceive<WH5377> you,<WH559> saying, Jerusalem<WH3389> will not be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>
Behold,<WH8085> you have heard what the kings<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> have done<WH6213> to all lands,<WH776> by destroying them utterly.<WH2763> Will you be delivered?<WH5337>

Have the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> delivered<WH5337> them,<WH1> which my fathers have destroyed,<WH7843> Gozan,<WH1470> and Haran,<WH2771> and Rezeph,<WH7530> and the children<WH1121> of Eden<WH5729> that were in Telassar?<WH8515>
Where is the king<WH4428> of Hamath,<WH2574> and the king<WH4428> of Arpad,<WH774> and the king<WH4428> of the city<WH5892> of Sepharvaim,<WH5617> of Hena,<WH2012> and Ivvah?<WH5755>"'"

Hezekiah<WH2396> received<WH3947> the letter<WH5612> from the hand<WH3027> of the messengers,<WH4397> and read<WH7121> it.<WH2396> Then Hezekiah went up<WH5927> to the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and spread<WH6566> it before<WH6440> Yahweh.<WH3068>

Hezekiah<WH2396> prayed<WH6419> before<WH6440> Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> "Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> who sit<WH3427> above the cherubim,<WH3742> you are the God,<WH430> even you alone,<WH4467> of all the kingdoms of the earth.<WH776> You have made<WH6213> heaven<WH8064> and earth.<WH776>

Incline<WH5186> your ear,<WH241> Yahweh,<WH3068> and hear.<WH8085> Open<WH6491> your eyes,<WH5869> Yahweh,<WH3068> and see.<WH7200> Hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of Sennacherib,<WH5576> with which he has sent<WH7971> to defy<WH2778> the living<WH2416> God.<WH430>
Truly,<WH551> Yahweh,<WH3068> the kings<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> have laid waste<WH2717> the nations<WH1471> and their lands,<WH776>

and have cast<WH5414> their gods<WH430> into the fire;<WH784> for they were no gods,<WH430> but the work<WH4639> of men<WH120>'s hands,<WH3027> wood<WH6086> and stone.<WH68> Therefore they have destroyed them.<WH6>

Now therefore,<WH3068> Yahweh our God,<WH430> save<WH3467> us,<WH3027> I beg you, out of his hand, that all the kingdoms<WH4467> of the earth<WH776> may know<WH3045> that you,<WH3068> Yahweh, are God alone.<WH430>"

Then Isaiah<WH3470> the son<WH1121> of Amoz<WH531> sent<WH7971> to Hezekiah,<WH2396> saying,<WH559> "Thus says<WH559> Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> <WH6419> 'Whereas you have prayed to me against Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> I have heard you.<WH8085>

This is the word<WH1697> that Yahweh<WH3068> has spoken<WH1696> concerning him:<WH1330> "The virgin daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726> has despised<WH959> you and ridiculed<WH3932> you.<WH1323> The daughter of Jerusalem<WH3389> has shaken<WH5128> her head<WH7218> at you.<WH310>

Whom have you defied<WH2778> and blasphemed?<WH1442> Against whom have you exalted<WH7311> your voice<WH6963> and lifted up<WH5375> your eyes<WH5869> on high?<WH4791> Against the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel.<WH3478>

By<WH3027> your messengers<WH4397> you have defied<WH2778> the Lord,<WH136> and have said,<WH559> <WH7230> 'With the multitude of my chariots,<WH7393> I have come up<WH5927> to the height<WH4791> of the mountains,<WH2022> to the innermost parts<WH3411> of Lebanon;<WH3844> and I will cut down<WH3772> its tall<WH6967> cedars,<WH730> and its choice<WH4004> fir trees;<WH1265> and I will enter<WH935> into his farthest<WH7093> lodging<WH4411> place,<WH3293> the forest of his fruitful field.<WH3760>
I have dug<WH6979> and drunk<WH8354> strange<WH2114> waters,<WH4325> and with the sole<WH3709> of my feet<WH6471> will I dry<WH2717> up all the rivers<WH2975> of Egypt.<WH4693>'

Haven't<WH8085> you heard how I have done<WH6213> it long ago,<WH7350> and formed<WH3335> it of ancient<WH6924> times?<WH3117> Now have I brought<WH935> it to pass,<WH7582> that it should be yours to lay waste fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> into ruinous<WH5327> heaps.<WH1530>

Therefore their inhabitants<WH3427> were of small<WH7116> power.<WH3027> They were dismayed<WH2865> and confounded.<WH954> They were like the grass<WH6212> of the field,<WH7704> and like the green<WH3419> herb,<WH1877> like the grass<WH2682> on the housetops,<WH1406> and like grain blasted<WH7711> before<WH6440> it has grown up.<WH7054>
But I know<WH3045> your sitting<WH3427> down,<WH3318> and your going out, and your coming in,<WH935> and your raging against me.<WH7264>

Because of your raging<WH7264> against me,<WH7600> and because your arrogance has come up<WH5927> into my ears,<WH241> therefore will I put<WH7760> my hook<WH2397> in your nose,<WH639> and my bridle<WH4964> in your lips,<WH8193> and I will turn you back<WH7725> by the way<WH1870> by which you came.<WH935>"

<WH226>"'This shall be the sign to you:<WH398> You shall eat this year<WH8141> that which grows<WH5599> of itself,<WH8145> and in the second year<WH8141> that which springs<WH7823> of the same;<WH7992> and in the third year<WH8141> sow,<WH2232> and reap,<WH7114> and plant<WH5193> vineyards,<WH3754> and eat<WH398> its fruit.<WH6529>
The remnant<WH7604> that has escaped<WH6413> of the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063> shall again<WH3254> take root<WH8328> downward,<WH4295> and bear<WH6213> fruit<WH6529> upward.<WH4605>

For out<WH3318> of Jerusalem<WH3389> a remnant<WH7611> will go out,<WH3318> and out of Mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> those who shall escape.<WH6413> The zeal<WH7068> of Yahweh<WH3068> will perform this.<WH6213>'

"Therefore thus says<WH559> Yahweh<WH3068> concerning the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> <WH935> 'He shall not come to this city,<WH5892> nor shoot<WH3384> an arrow<WH2671> there,<WH6923> neither shall he come before it with shield,<WH4043> nor cast<WH8210> up a mound against it.<WH5550>
By the way<WH1870> that he came,<WH935> by the same shall he return,<WH7725> and he shall not come<WH935> to this city,<WH5892>' says<WH5002> Yahweh.<WH3068>
<WH1598> 'For I will defend this city<WH5892> to save<WH3467> it,<WH5650> for my own sake, and for my servant David<WH1732>'s sake.'"

It happened that night,<WH3915> that the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> went out,<WH3318> and struck<WH5221> one hundred<WH3967> eighty<WH8084> - five<WH2568> thousand<WH505> in the camp<WH4264> of the Assyrians.<WH804> When men arose early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH7925> behold,<WH4191> these were all dead bodies.<WH6297>
So Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> departed,<WH5265> and went<WH3212> and returned,<WH7725> and lived<WH3427> at Nineveh.<WH5210>

It happened,<WH7812> as he was worshipping in the house<WH1004> of Nisroch<WH5268> his god,<WH430> that Adrammelech<WH152> and Sharezer<WH8272> <WH1121> struck<WH5221> him with the sword;<WH2719> and they escaped<WH4422> into the land<WH776> of Ararat.<WH780> Esar Haddon<WH634> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
